Package taskallocation

Interface ITaskManager

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.Observer
All Known Implementing Classes:
TaskManager
public interface ITaskManager
extends java.util.Observer
Interface for the component that manages task allocation and availability. The implementation must maintain a mapping of Task allocated to each worker and a record of available tasks which is constantly updated when the task is allocated or de-allocated. Tasks should be given in FIFO manner to prevent starvation. The implementation must listen to heartbeat manager notifications and deallocate the task if assigned to the failed worker. Should allocate one task to the worker at a time. Does not work for scenarios where multiple tasks are being handled by single worker.

Note: All the functions and data-structures should be thread safe as there would be multiple allocation request waiting for a task to be available or allocated.

Author:
somilgupta

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static boolean DEBUG  
    static int TASK_ALLOCATION_SERVER_PORT
    Port at which the master would listen to task allocation requests from the workers.

  • Field Details

    • DEBUG

      static final boolean DEBUG
      See Also:

    • TASK_ALLOCATION_SERVER_PORT

      static final int TASK_ALLOCATION_SERVER_PORT
      Port at which the master would listen to task allocation requests from the workers.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • allocateTask

      Task allocateTask​(int workerId) throws NoTaskAvailableException
      Allocate the task if any available. If a task is already allocated to the worker, then return back the same task. This function should ideally be called after querying availability at {isAnyTaskAvailable()}.
      Parameters:
      workerId - Identifier of the worker.
      Returns:
      Task denoting the allocated task to be done.
      Throws:
      NoTaskAvailableException - Race condition may cause the task to get allocated before request. In that case no task would be available and this exception would be thrown. Upstream should catch this exception and take action.

    • deallocateTask

      void deallocateTask​(int workerId)
      Deallocate the task assigned to the worker. This may happen when the worker dies unexpectedly and task needs to be reallocated. Should do nothing if already de-allocated.
      Parameters:
      workerId - worker identifier.

    • isAnyTaskAvailable

      boolean isAnyTaskAvailable()
      Checks if any task is available for allocation. Please note that even though this shows true at the moment of call, the task may get allocated when allocation request made. Caller must treat both calls as atomic to prevent race conditions.
      Returns:
      True if available else false.

    • areAllTasksCompleted

      boolean areAllTasksCompleted()
      Notifies true when there is no task left to allocate and no ongoing active task.
      Returns:
      true when all tasks are notified by the workers to be completed.

    • markTaskCompleted

      void markTaskCompleted​(int workerId)
      Marks the task to be completed. This should ensure that the task does not appear in the available/ongoing task pool.
      Parameters:
      workerId - workerId that completed the task. The task allocated to this worker is completed.

    • log

      static void log​(java.lang.String message)
      Specific log message for task manager component.
      Parameters:
      message - Specific message.
